title: Tsonga (1996) Genesis Portion
description: Tsonga, or Xitsonga as an endonym, is a Bantu language spoken by the Tsonga people of southern Africa. It is mutually intelligible with Tswa and Ronga and the name "Tsonga" is often used as a cover term for all three, also sometimes referred to as Tswa-Ronga. The Xitsonga language has been standardized for both academic and home use. Tsonga is an official language of South Africa, and under the name "Shangani" it is recognized as an official language in the Constitution of Zimbabwe. All Tswa-Ronga languages are recognized in Mozambique. It is not official in Eswatini (formerly Swaziland).
